documentation.text:
@title Host interface
 @author Superfluid
 NOTE:
 This is the central contract of the system where super agreement, super app
 and super token features are connected.
 The Superfluid host contract is also the entry point for the protocol users,
 where batch call and meta transaction are provided for UX improvements.
@dev Get the current governance address of the Superfluid host
@dev Replace the current governance with a new one

@notice Check if the agreement type is whitelisted
 @dev agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"
@dev Check if the agreement class is whitelisted

@notice Get agreement class
 @dev agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"

@dev Map list of the agreement classes using a bitmap
 @param bitmap Agreement class bitmap

@dev Get the super token factory
 @return factory The factory

@dev Get the super token factory logic (applicable to upgradable deployment)
 @return logic The factory logic

@dev Update super token factory
 @param newFactory New factory logic

@dev SuperToken factory updated event
 @param newFactory Address of the new factory

@notice Update the super token logic to the latest
 @dev Refer to ISuperTokenFactory.Upgradability for expected behaviours

@dev SuperToken logic updated event
 @param code Address of the new SuperToken logic

@dev App registered event
 @param app Address of jailed app

@dev Query if the app is registered
 @param app Super app address

@dev Query app level
 @param app Super app address

@dev Get the manifest of the super app
 @param app Super app address

@dev Query if the app has been jailed
 @param app Super app address

@dev Whitelist the target app for app composition for the source app (msg.sender)
 @param targetApp The target super app address

@dev Batch call function
 @param operations Array of batch operations

@dev Batch call function for trusted forwarders (EIP-2771)
 @param operations Array of batch operations

natspec.author: Superfluid NOTE: This is the central contract of the system where super agreement, super app and super token features are connected. The Superfluid host contract is also the entry point for the protocol users, where batch call and meta transaction are provided for UX improvements.

AgreementClassRegistered(bytes32,address.details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"

AgreementClassUpdated(bytes32,address).details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"

params.newGov: Address of the new governance contract
params.oldGov: Address of the old governance contract

params.reason: Reason the app is jailed (see Definitions.sol for the full list)

params.code: Address of the new SuperToken logic

addToAgreementClassesBitmap(uint256,byte.details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"
addToAgreementClassesBitmap(uint256,byte.notice: Create a new bitmask by adding a agreement class to it

allowCompositeApp(address).details: Whitelist the target app for app composition for the source app (msg.sender)

appCallbackPop(bytes,int256).details: (For agreements) Pop from the current app callback stack

params.appAllowanceUsedDelta: App allowance used by the app.
params.ctx: The ctx that was pushed before the callback stack.

returns.newCtx: [SECURITY] NOTE: - Here we cannot do assertValidCtx(ctx), since we do not really save the stack in memory. - Hence there is still implicit trust that the agreement handles the callback push/pop pair correctly.

appCallbackPush(bytes,address,uint256,in.details: (For agreements) Create a new callback stack

params.ctx: The current ctx, it will be validated.

params.agreementClass: The agreement address you are calling
params.callData: The contextual call data with placeholder ctx
params.userData: Extra user data being sent to the super app callbacks

callAppAction(address,bytes).details: Main use case is calling app action in a batch call via the host

params.callData: The contextual call data NOTE: See "Contextless Call Proxies" above for more about contextual call data.

callAppAfterCallback(address,bytes,bool,.details: (For agreements) Call the app after callback

params.callData: The call data sending to the super app.
params.ctx: Current ctx, it will be validated.

callAppBeforeCallback(address,bytes,bool.details: (For agreements) StaticCall the app before callback

params.callData: The call data sending to the super app.
params.ctx: Current ctx, it will be validated.

params.appAllowanceUsedDelta: See app allowance for more details.
params.appAllowanceWantedMore: See app allowance for more details.
params.ctx: The current ctx, it will be validated.

forwardBatchCall((uint32,address,bytes)[.details: Batch call function for trusted forwarders (EIP-2771)

getAgreementClass(bytes32).details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"

getAppManifest(address).details: Get the manifest of the super app

getGovernance().details: Get the current governance address of the Superfluid host

getSuperTokenFactoryLogic().details: Get the super token factory logic (applicable to upgradable deployment)

isAgreementClassListed(address).details: Check if the agreement class is whitelisted

isAgreementTypeListed(bytes32).details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"
isAgreementTypeListed(bytes32).notice: Check if the agreement type is whitelisted

isApp(address).details: Query if the app is registered

isAppJailed(address).details: Query if the app has been jailed

isCompositeAppAllowed(address,address).details: Query if source app is allowed to call the target app as downstream app

mapAgreementClasses(uint256).details: Map list of the agreement classes using a bitmap

registerAgreementClass(address).details: Register a new agreement class to the system

params.agreementClassLogic: Initial agreement class code Modifiers:  - onlyGovernance

registerApp(uint256).details: Message sender declares it as a super app

params.configWord: The super app manifest configuration, flags are defined in `SuperAppDefinitions`

registerAppByFactory(address,uint256).details: Message sender declares app as a super app

params.configWord: The super app manifest configuration, flags are defined in `SuperAppDefinitions` NOTE: only factory contracts authorized by governance can register super apps

registerAppWithKey(uint256,string).details: Message sender declares it as a super app, using a registration key

params.configWord: The super app manifest configuration, flags are defined in `SuperAppDefinitions`
params.registrationKey: The registration key issued by the governance

removeFromAgreementClassesBitmap(uint256.details: agreementType is the keccak256 hash of: "org.superfluid-finance.agreements.<AGREEMENT_NAME>.<VERSION>"
removeFromAgreementClassesBitmap(uint256.notice: Create a new bitmask by removing a agreement class from it

replaceGovernance(address).details: Replace the current governance with a new one

updateAgreementClass(address).details: Update code of an agreement class

params.agreementClassLogic: New code for the agreement class Modifiers:  - onlyGovernance

updateSuperTokenLogic(address).details: Refer to ISuperTokenFactory.Upgradability for expected behaviours
updateSuperTokenLogic(address).notice: Update the super token logic to the latest

natspec.title: Host interface
